titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3004, KATE'S LAW, AND PROVIDING FOR PROCEEDINGS DURING THE PERIOD FROM JULY 3, 2017, THROUGH JULY 10, 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3004, KATE'S LAW, AND PROVIDING FOR PROCEEDINGS DURING THE PERIOD FROM JULY 3, 2017, THROUGH JULY 10, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 112

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3004, to amend section 276 of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to reentry of removed aliens, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 344.<P/>Rejected the Lofgren motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 193 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 343.<P/>H. Res. 415, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3004) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 191 noes, Roll No. 340, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 339.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3004, to amend section 276 of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to reentry of removed aliens, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 344.<P/>Rejected the Lofgren motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 193 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 343.<P/>H. Res. 415, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3004) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 191 noes, Roll No. 340, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 339.

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3003, to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to modify provisions relating to assistance by States, and political subdivision of States, in the enforcement of Federal immigration laws, by a yea-and-nay vote of 228 yeas to 195 nays, Roll No. 342.<P/>Rejected the Demings motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 181 yeas to 230 nays, Roll No. 341.

The House passed H.R. 3003, to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to modify provisions relating to assistance by States, and political subdivision of States, in the enforcement of Federal immigration laws, by a yea-and-nay vote of 228 yeas to 195 nays, Roll No. 342.

The House passed H.R. 3003, to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to modify provisions relating to assistance by States, and political subdivision of States, in the enforcement of Federal immigration laws, by a yea-and-nay vote of 228 yeas to 195 nays, Roll No. 342.<P/>Rejected the Demings motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 181 yeas to 230 nays, Roll No. 341.

extension.searchTitle: KATE'S LAW; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 112

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3004, to amend section 276 of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to reentry of removed aliens, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 344.<P/>Rejected the Lofgren motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 193 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 343.
The House passed H.R. 3004, to amend section 276 of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to reentry of removed aliens, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 344.

The House passed H.R. 3004, to amend section 276 of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to reentry of removed aliens, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 344.<P/>Rejected the Lofgren motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 193 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 343.
